definition: very early in the morning/in the wee hours
to approach/to rise high/thick ice/to insult or maltreat

sentences.english: The atmosphere in the early hours of Tuesday's anti-government rally was friendly.
sentences.chinese: 在周二的反政府集会凌晨气氛友好。

sentences.english: And if you sleep at 2am, you only have 1 hour to detoxify.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在凌晨2点睡觉，就只有1小时排毒时间。

sentences.english: It was with immense relief that just before 1am we finally chugged back into life.
sentences.chinese: 在凌晨1点之前火车终于开了，我们如释重负。

sentences.english: But anon I slept too until the early morning light ended what rest we both'd got at half six or so.
sentences.chinese: 但不久我也睡觉了，直到凌晨光结束了我们的休息。

sentences.english: Let's just suppose that at 3:20 a.m.
sentences.chinese: 让我们假设昨天凌晨三点二十分。

sentences.english: I chislenge you to a duel found on dawn the next day.
sentences.chinese: 我在第二天的凌晨向你寻事。

sentences.english: Yu just arrived in Beijing by bus in the early hours on Monday from eastern Shandong Province.
sentences.chinese: 星期一凌晨于老师刚从山东省东部赶达北京。

sentences.english: Carnival crowd to 2:00 Xu, only slightly tipsy out of the bar.
sentences.chinese: 众人狂欢至凌晨2点许，才略带醉意步出酒吧。
在凌晨3点你的电话铃响起。

sentences.english: Until 3a. m. , the shop closed, I have gone too.
sentences.chinese: 到了凌晨3点，店打烊了，我们也该走了。
凌晨12时30分后，严励禁止测试。
凌晨4点钟，伞兵们开始跳伞。

sentences.english: Early morning departure of 2am on Mondays and Tuesdays only.
sentences.chinese: 只有每周一和周二才有凌晨2点的早班车。

sentences.english: At least the police are not rigorously enforcing a threatened ban on carousing after 2am.
sentences.chinese: 至少警方这次不强制禁止凌晨2点后的狂欢行为了。

sentences.english: Mrs. Semple called me at half past four.
sentences.chinese: 山普太太凌晨四点半叫我起床。

sentences.english: A powerful aftershock occurred at 01:15 local time Tuesday (2315 GMT Monday).
sentences.chinese: 一次较为强力的余震发生于周二凌晨一点十五分。

definition: in the evening/when night falls/towards evening/at night fall/at dusk
midnight/in the middle of the night
